popt4jlib.MSSC

Class NeuralGasMTClusterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC.NeuralGasMTClusterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClustererIntf

    public final class NeuralGasMTClusterer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClustererIntf
    parallel implementation of Neural Gas by Martinetz & Schulten for MSSC. The algorithm has many similarities with the Det. Annealing algorithm of Rose (also implemented as a sequential algorithm in this package), but has much greater parallelism potential in its update phase.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Method Detail

      • clusterVectors

        public java.util.Vector clusterVectors()
                                throws ClustererException
        the most important method of the class. Some parameters must have been previously passed in the _params map (call setParams(p) to do that). These are:
      • <"neuralgasmt.TerminationCriteria",ClustererTerminationIntf> the object that will decide when to stop the iterations. Mandatory. Essentially only the ClustererTerminationNumIters criterion makes sense for this algorithm (the ClustererTerminationNo[Center]Move neither make sense nor will they work correctly if registered with this object).
      • <"neuralgasmt.numthreads",Integer nt> optional, how many threads will be used to compute the clustering, default is 1. Note: unless the dimensionality of the points is high enough, or the ratio num_points/num_clusters is big enough, so that the tasks to be executed in parallel have enough "work" to do so that the overhead associated with creating and running tasks in parallel in the PDBatchTaskExecutor is justified, it will be faster to run using only 1 thread (this criterion applies to most situations where tasks are executed in parallel).
      • <"neuralgasmt.seed",Long s> optional, if present, the seed for the random number generator to be used in shuffling the data vectors for presentation order to the update formula. Default is null, resulting in random seed each time the method is invoked.

        Also, before calling the method, the vectors to be clustered must have been added to the class object via addAllVectors(Vector) or via repeated calls to addVector(VectorIntf d), and an initial clustering must be available via a call to setInitialClustering(Vector clusterCenters).

        The method works by iteratively presenting one of the document vectors each time t to the centers (ordered by distance to the cur. document vector x) and updating the k-th center according to the formula c_k(t+1) = c_k(t) + ε(t)*exp(-k/λ(t))*(x-c_k(t)) where the sequences ε(t) and λ(t) are both decreasing sequences tending to zero. In this implementation, λ(t) = 1/sqrt(t) ε(t) = 1/t.

Specified by:
clusterVectors in interface ClustererIntf
Returns:
Vector Vector the best centers (aka codebooks) found that minimize distortion error, ie MSSC.
Throws:
ClustererException

    public int[] getClusteringIndices()
    returns the indices indicating to which cluster each vector (in the order added to this object's _docs Vector) belongs. The values of the indices are in the range {0, 1, 2, ... _centers.size()-1}.

  • getClusterCards

    public int[] getClusterCards()
                      throws ClustererException
    return an int[] specifying the cardinalities of each cluster in the current clustering. The length of the returned array is equal to _centers.size(), namely the number of centers passed in during the call setInitialClustering(centers).
    Specified by:
    getClusterCards in interface ClustererIntf
    Returns:
